meta.title: JAA Home Health Help Finder
meta.subtitle: Quick help for home health, hospice, transportation, benefits, and aging support
notes: Information may change. If a number is busy or a program is full, try another option.
If this is a medical emergency, call 911.
If you feel unsafe, threatened, or in emotional crisis, call/text 988.
For behavioral health crisis help in Allegheny County, call re:solve Crisis Network: 1-888-796-8226.

primary_contact.name: JAA Home Health Services (Jewish Association on Aging)
primary_contact.short: Call for home health intake, skilled nursing/therapy coordination, and service questions.

items.name: Allegheny County Area Agency on Aging (AAA) – SeniorLine
items.hours: Walk-in Mon–Fri 8:30 AM–4:30 PM (phone line hours may vary)
items.summary: Front door for aging services: information & referral, OPTIONS care management, caregiver support, benefits assistance referrals, senior centers, and Adult P...
items.details: Who they serve: Older adults (typically 60+), caregivers, and professionals seeking aging services in Allegheny County | Limitations/notes: Service availability can vary by program eligibility, funding, and waitlists.

items.name: Adult Protective Services (APS) – Allegheny County
items.summary: Investigates reports and coordinates protective interventions and support services.
items.details: Who they serve: Adults 60+ who may be at risk of abuse, neglect, exploitation, or abandonment (including self-neglect) | Limitations/notes: Eligibility is typically 60+ (PA APS). If under 60, call DHS/DAL or Disability Rights PA for guidance.

items.name: DHS Director’s Action Line (DAL) – Allegheny County
items.summary: Navigation/help line to connect people to county human services and troubleshoot barriers.
items.details: Who they serve: Allegheny County residents needing help navigating DHS services (housing, food, benefits, etc.) | Limitations/notes: Not an emergency line; response depends on program eligibility/availability.

items.name: Allegheny Link (Coordinated Entry / housing & support navigation)
items.address: Human Services Building, One Smithfield St., Pittsburgh, PA 15222
items.hours: In-person Mon–Fri 8:00 AM–4:00 PM (call hours may vary)
items.summary: Single access point for housing/shelter navigation; can connect to case management and related supports.
items.details: Who they serve: People seeking housing navigation, shelter access, or coordinated entry supports | Limitations/notes: Prioritization is needs-based; housing resources can be limited.

items.name: PA 211 Southwest (resource navigation)
items.summary: Information & referral service for community resources.
items.details: Who they serve: Anyone needing help finding local resources (bills, food, housing, etc.) | Limitations/notes: Provides referrals; does not directly deliver services.

items.name: re:solve Crisis Services (Allegheny County)
items.address: Walk-in: 333 N Braddock Ave., Pittsburgh, PA 15208
items.hours: 24/7 hotline + walk-in crisis center; mobile crisis team available countywide
items.summary: 24/7 crisis support, walk-in services, and mobile crisis response.
items.details: Who they serve: Allegheny County residents experiencing behavioral health crisis | Limitations/notes: For imminent medical danger call 911; non-urgent counseling usually requires follow-up referral.

items.name: 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline (nationwide)
items.summary: Immediate emotional support and crisis connection.
items.details: Who they serve: Anyone in emotional distress or suicidal crisis | Limitations/notes: Crisis support, not a substitute for ongoing medical/psychiatric care.

items.name: Pittsburgh Regional Transit (PRT) – ACCESS / Paratransit
items.summary: Door-to-door paratransit transportation (often using contracted providers).
items.details: Who they serve: Individuals with disabilities who cannot use fixed-route transit; requires eligibility evaluation | Limitations/notes: Eligibility required; scheduling windows/ride times can vary; shared-ride model.

items.name: PRT – Senior Free Fare (ConnectCard)
items.address: Apply/registration online; card use on PRT services
items.hours: Online registration; travel per PRT schedules
items.summary: Free fares for seniors on PRT services with proper senior ID/registration.
items.details: Who they serve: Allegheny County residents age 65+ | Limitations/notes: Requires registration/ID; applies to PRT services (not all private carriers).

items.name: Older Persons Transportation (OPT) – discounted shared rides
items.summary: Discounted shared rides to necessary errands (medical appointments, groceries, etc.).
items.details: Who they serve: Adults age 60+ | Limitations/notes: Trip purpose limits; advance scheduling often required; capacity constraints possible.

items.name: AgeWell Pittsburgh (JFCS) – rides, resources, caregiver support
items.summary: Volunteer-based rides and supportive services; can help with errands/appointments and aging resources.
items.details: Who they serve: Typically 60+ (and some caregivers) | Limitations/notes: Volunteer capacity may limit scheduling; service area and trip types may be restricted.

items.name: GoGoGrandparent (Uber/Lyft relay for seniors)
items.summary: Calls/texts to request Uber/Lyft rides without smartphone apps.
items.details: Who they serve: Adults who prefer phone-based ride ordering; credit card required | Limitations/notes: Fee-based private service; requires registration and payment method.

items.name: Medicaid transportation (MATP / plan-based non-emergency transport)
items.display_phone: Call your Medicaid plan member services
items.summary: Non-emergency medical transportation benefit offered through plans or MATP network.
items.details: Who they serve: People with Medicaid / Medical Assistance | Limitations/notes: Trip must be medical/covered; prior authorization may apply; provider networks vary.

items.name: OPTIONS Program (AAA Care Management)
items.summary: Assessment, service planning, and coordination (home-delivered meals, personal care, respite, etc.).
items.details: Who they serve: Older adults needing assessment & care coordination to remain safely at home | Limitations/notes: Funding/eligibility vary; some services may have waitlists or cost-sharing.

items.name: UPMC Living-At-Home Program (geriatric care management)
items.summary: Care coordination, assessments, and support planning for older adults living at home.
items.details: Who they serve: Older adults and families seeking care management, navigation, aging-in-place support | Limitations/notes: May be fee-based depending on services; not a substitute for emergency services.

items.name: Independent Enrollment Broker (IEB) – PA LTSS eligibility/enrollment
items.summary: Helps start LTSS applications and connects to assessments and managed care enrollment.
items.details: Who they serve: People applying for Medicaid long-term services & supports (including Aging Waiver and disability waivers) | Limitations/notes: Requires Medicaid eligibility and level-of-care determination; processing time varies.

items.name: Community HealthChoices (CHC) Helpline – PA DHS
items.summary: Information on CHC managed long-term services supports and enrollment steps.
items.details: Who they serve: Adults needing LTSS through CHC (older adults and adults with physical disabilities) | Limitations/notes: CHC is for eligible participants; MCO plan networks vary.

items.name: Allegheny County Office of Developmental Supports (ODS)
items.summary: Intake and connection to services for people with ID/A through county supports and waivers.
items.details: Who they serve: Individuals with intellectual disabilities/autism and their families | Limitations/notes: Eligibility determination required; services depend on waiver funding/availability.

items.name: JAA Home Health Services (Jewish Association on Aging)
items.summary: Skilled nursing, therapy, and home health services (coverage varies).
items.details: Who they serve: Adults needing skilled home health services (often after hospitalization or with chronic needs) | Limitations/notes: Typically requires physician order and insurance authorization; visit frequency based on need/coverage.

items.name: AHN Healthcare@Home (home health, hospice, palliative, infusion, DME)
items.hours: Call for intake hours (clinical support as needed)
items.summary: Home health, hospice, palliative care, infusion therapy, and medical equipment delivery.
items.details: Who they serve: Patients needing home-based medical services and supplies | Limitations/notes: Service area/insurance coverage vary; physician orders required for many services.

items.name: UPMC at Home (home health services)
items.display_phone: Use website for local branch contact (multiple locations)
items.summary: Home health services through UPMC at Home network.
items.details: Who they serve: Patients needing skilled home care (nursing, rehab, etc.) | Limitations/notes: Coverage/eligibility depend on medical necessity and insurance authorization.

items.name: Sivitz Hospice & Palliative Care (JAA)
items.hours: Call for intake; hospice support is typically 24/7
items.summary: Hospice and palliative care services with bereavement support.
items.details: Who they serve: People with serious illness and those eligible for hospice services; caregivers | Limitations/notes: Hospice eligibility typically requires physician certification and a limited prognosis; insurance rules apply.

items.name: UPMC Family Hospice, Part of UPMC – West (serves Allegheny County)
items.address: 300 Northpointe Cir., Suite 303, Seven Fields, PA 16046
items.hours: Hospice support typically 24/7; call for intake
items.summary: Hospice and palliative services plus bereavement support.
items.details: Who they serve: Hospice-eligible patients and families in Southwest PA (including Allegheny County) | Limitations/notes: Eligibility per Medicare/insurance hospice benefit; service area coverage applies.

items.name: AHN Hospice (Healthcare@Home)
items.summary: Hospice care with interdisciplinary team support.
items.details: Who they serve: Hospice-eligible patients and families in Western PA | Limitations/notes: Eligibility/coverage depend on payer rules; service area applies.

items.name: LIFE Pittsburgh (PACE Program of All-Inclusive Care for the Elderly)
items.summary: Integrated medical + social model: day centers, home supports, primary care, transportation, therapies.
items.details: Who they serve: Typically age 55+ who qualify for nursing-facility level of care but can live safely in the community | Limitations/notes: Eligibility assessment required; enrollment capacity may vary; generally Medicare/Medicaid based.

items.name: Anathan Adult Day Memory Care Services (JAA)
items.summary: Adult day services with supervision, activities, and caregiver respite.
items.details: Who they serve: Adults needing adult day services, including memory care supports | Limitations/notes: Schedule/costs vary; may require intake and health screening.

items.name: Home-Delivered Meals (Allegheny County) – start via SeniorLine
items.summary: Entry point for home-delivered meals and related food resources.
items.details: Who they serve: Older adults who are homebound or need nutrition support | Limitations/notes: Eligibility and wait times vary; assessment may be required.

items.name: Meals on Wheels Greater Pittsburgh (general contact)
items.summary: Meal delivery programs serving different neighborhoods through partner routes.
items.details: Who they serve: Homebound older adults/individuals needing meal delivery (varies by program) | Limitations/notes: Service areas differ by route/provider; donation/cost structures vary.

items.name: Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank – Senior Box Program
items.summary: Monthly box of shelf-stable food items (site-based distribution).
items.details: Who they serve: Eligible older adults (income/age criteria may apply) | Limitations/notes: Eligibility requirements apply; schedule varies by location.

items.name: PA MEDI (formerly APPRISE) – Medicare counseling / SHIP
items.summary: Free, unbiased Medicare counseling: enrollment, plan comparisons, appeals guidance.
items.details: Who they serve: Medicare beneficiaries and caregivers | Limitations/notes: Counseling only; does not provide direct insurance coverage.

items.name: PACE / PACENET – PA prescription assistance (65+)
items.hours: Call for assistance; applications via phone/online/mail
items.summary: State prescription assistance that works with Medicare Part D to reduce out-of-pocket costs.
items.details: Who they serve: PA residents age 65+ meeting income and insurance criteria | Limitations/notes: Income eligibility; must maintain other coverage requirements; formulary/benefits rules apply.

items.name: GoodRx (discount cards/price comparisons)
items.summary: Price comparison and discount coupons at participating pharmacies.
items.details: Who they serve: Anyone buying prescriptions (cash-pay discounts may apply) | Limitations/notes: Not insurance; discounts vary by pharmacy and medication.

items.name: ACorx (bubble-packaged medication organization)
items.summary: Medication packaging/organization service (insurance billed; copays typically unchanged).
items.details: Website: (check local listing) | Who they serve: People who want pre-sorted medications in blister/bubble packs | Limitations/notes: Not a discount program; availability and delivery options vary.

items.name: Pennsylvania SeniorLAW HelpLine (Older Pennsylvanians Legal Assistance Program)
items.summary: Free legal information/advice/referrals; brief services in certain areas of elder law.
items.details: Who they serve: Pennsylvanians age 60+ | Limitations/notes: Scope limits by topic; capacity may vary.

items.name: Pennsylvania Health Law Project (PHLP) – Medicaid/healthcare legal help
items.hours: Helpline open Mondays & Wednesdays starting 8 AM (verify current schedule)
items.summary: Free legal help on Medicaid/healthcare access issues.
items.details: Who they serve: People needing help accessing Medicaid/health benefits, coverage issues, appeals | Limitations/notes: Healthcare/benefits focus (not a general civil legal clinic).

items.name: Disability Rights Pennsylvania (DRP) – disability legal advocacy
items.summary: Legal advocacy, rights information, and assistance for disability-related issues.
items.details: Who they serve: People with disabilities (all ages) and advocates | Limitations/notes: Not all cases can be accepted; prioritization by issue area and capacity.

items.name: Pennsylvania Long-Term Care Ombudsman (nursing homes, assisted living, personal care homes)
items.summary: Advocates for resident rights; helps resolve complaints and quality-of-care concerns.
items.details: Who they serve: Residents of long-term care facilities and their families | Limitations/notes: Ombudsman is an advocate, not a regulator; emergency safety concerns may require APS/911.

items.name: Property Tax / Rent Rebate (PTRR) – PA Dept. of Revenue
items.hours: Call for hours; online via myPATH
items.summary: Rebates for property tax or rent paid in PA (up to program maximums).
items.details: Who they serve: Older adults 65+, widows/widowers 50+, and adults 18+ with disabilities (income limits apply) | Limitations/notes: Annual application and eligibility rules; deadlines apply.

items.name: LIHEAP (Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program) – PA DHS
items.hours: Hotline Mon–Fri; crisis assistance 24/7 via county assistance office
items.summary: Heating assistance grants and crisis supports for eligible households.
items.details: Who they serve: Low-income households needing help with heating bills or heating crisis | Limitations/notes: Seasonal program windows; eligibility depends on income and household info.

items.name: Duquesne Light – Customer Assistance Program (CAP)
items.hours: Customer service Mon–Fri 8 AM–5 PM (automated phone system 24/7)
items.summary: Reduced monthly payments and payment plans to help maintain electric service.
items.details: Who they serve: Eligible low-income Duquesne Light customers | Limitations/notes: Requires eligibility; program rules apply; must be within service territory.

items.name: Rebuilding Together Pittsburgh (home repairs for qualified homeowners)
items.summary: Critical home repairs and safety modifications (program-dependent).
items.details: Who they serve: Homeowners who qualify (often older adults/low-income/disabled) | Limitations/notes: Eligibility and waitlists vary; project scope depends on funding/volunteers.

items.name: ACTION-Housing (housing help, repairs, accessibility, weatherization programs vary)
items.summary: Housing services and programs that may include home repairs/modifications depending on eligibility.
items.details: Who they serve: Residents needing housing stabilization, accessibility help, or repairs (program-specific) | Limitations/notes: Programs vary; documentation and eligibility requirements apply.

items.name: TechOWL (PA Assistive Technology Program)
items.summary: Assistive technology info, device demonstrations/loans (program-dependent), and accessibility support.
items.details: Who they serve: People with disabilities, older adults, caregivers | Limitations/notes: Not a direct equipment vendor for all devices; program scope varies.

items.name: Pennsylvania Assistive Technology Foundation (PATF) – financing for AT
items.summary: Loans and programs to help finance assistive technology and accessibility modifications.
items.details: Who they serve: Pennsylvanians needing financing for assistive technology or home modifications | Limitations/notes: Loan approval/terms apply; not a grant program in most cases.

items.name: Kane Community Living Centers (Allegheny County) – public nursing facilities
items.address: Locations include Glen Hazel, McKeesport, Scott Township, Ross Township (verify)
items.summary: County-operated long-term care facilities and rehabilitation.
items.details: Who they serve: Individuals needing skilled nursing / long-term care (eligibility and payor mix varies) | Limitations/notes: Admissions depend on bed availability and clinical criteria.

items.name: Home Instead (Pittsburgh area)
items.summary: Non-medical in-home caregiving: companionship, personal care assistance, respite.
items.details: Limitations/notes: Private-pay or LTC insurance; availability depends on staffing and service area.

items.name: Visiting Angels (Pittsburgh)
items.summary: Non-medical home care: personal care, companionship, respite, dementia support options.
items.details: Limitations/notes: Private-pay or LTC insurance; availability depends on staffing and service area.

items.name: Comfort Keepers (Pittsburgh City)
items.summary: Non-medical in-home care, companionship, personal care, respite.
items.details: Limitations/notes: Private-pay or LTC insurance; availability depends on staffing and service area.

items.name: Right at Home (Greater Pittsburgh)
items.summary: Non-medical home care, personal care, companionship, light housekeeping, respite.
items.details: Limitations/notes: Private-pay or LTC insurance; availability depends on staffing and service area.
